page.title: 03THE WOODLAND INCE BLUNDELL
page.content:
The woodland is this area stands out in sharp contrast to the low-lying landscape. Most of the trees are planted in small "clumps" to form windbreaks around houses and fields.
The most extensive area of woodland lies within the park wall.
The prettiest part of this is known locally as the "Westicroft". Much of it was planted by Charles Weld-Blundell as a pleasant walk for his wife. We counted 25 different species of trees including both deciduous and conifers. Between the trees are wide woodland paths of lush grass scattered with primroses and wild-violets.
